wells.name: W-11
safetyLockReasons: Tubing severely restricted with hard scale

sandControl.type: Internal Gravel Pack (IGP) with 12-gauge premium screens
sandControl.status: FAILED - THE FLAW: Screen gauge too large, fines migration

interventions.objective: Run IGP, set packer, run ESP
interventions.outcome: SUCCESS
interventions.aiAnalysis: Retrospective: Completion design flagged for fines migration risk

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS - Well exceeds expectations at 19,500 bopd
interventions.notes: The golden years

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS - Pump replaced, found coated in fine scale
interventions.aiAnalysis: First data point for scale model. Predicts accelerating deposition.

interventions.outcome: DECISION: Declined specialized inhibitor due to cost
interventions.aiAnalysis: CRITICAL INFLECTION POINT - Cost-saving measure with projected future cost >$50M

interventions.objective: Mill out scale in tubing to restore flow
interventions.outcome: FAILED - Milling 1-2 m/hr, CT stuck at 2,500m
interventions.aiAnalysis: Predicted 75% probability of stuck pipe based on scale hardness and CT fatigue model

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS - CT retrieved after multiple high-risk jarring runs
interventions.aiAnalysis: Jarring forces now correlated with casing integrity uncertainty

aiRecommendation.summary: 92% probability of failure for any further clean-out attempt. Economic model strongly favors sidetrack.
aiRecommendation.rationale: Static environment critical for long-duration milling. Incorporate lessons learned into new completion design.

lessonsLearned.title: Screen gauge sizing in high-fines reservoirs
lessonsLearned.description: Screen gauge was slightly too large, allowing formation fines to migrate slowly over years

lessonsLearned.title: Cost-saving on scale inhibition has catastrophic long-term consequences
lessonsLearned.description: 2015 decision to decline specialized inhibitor led to >$50M in remediation costs

identity.operator: Brahan Field Operating Company (Inherited from North Sea Explorers Ltd. - defunct)

reservoir.shallowGasRisk: HIGH - Gas pocket identified at ~600m TVD above 13-3/8" shoe

casingProgram.name: Surface
casingProgram.notes: OUTDATED GRADE - High risk for modern load cycles

casingProgram.name: Intermediate
casingProgram.notes: OUTDATED GRADE - Shoe in shallow gas window

mysteryObstruction.description: Unknown mass discovered during 2023 drift run

wellhead.status: Valves replaced 2023, annulus valves welded shut due to leaks

interventions.outcome: COMPLETED (POORLY) - Bridge plug set, cement dump, vague records
interventions.aiAnalysis: CATASTROPHICALLY NON-COMPLIANT with modern standards. >80% probability of long-term barrier failure.

interventions.outcome: MAJOR DISCOVERY - Brahan Delta prospect identified, ideal for sidetrack from W-22
PARTIAL SUCCESS - Replaced master/wing valves, annulus valves welded shut
interventions.notes: Wellhead area now flagged as Red Zone for personnel

interventions.objective: Drift run to check for obstructions
interventions.outcome: NEW PROBLEM - Drift held up at 3,430m. Mystery Obstruction discovered.
interventions.aiAnalysis: 95% probability of stuck pipe on next run. Recommended LIB.

interventions.outcome: INCONCLUSIVE - Smeared, unclear impression
interventions.aiAnalysis: Classified as non-metallic, semi-solid mass. Cross-referenced with 1987 logbook 'sludgy cement' note. 70% probability degraded cement.

aiRecommendation.summary: 95% probability of well control incident if entered without stable platform. Two-phase approach required.
aiRecommendation.phase1: Mobilize Jack-Up Rig for full well control operation, kill well, verify and set modern barriers, P&A original wellbore below sidetrack point
aiRecommendation.phase2: Use same Jack-Up to drill sidetrack to Brahan Delta target
aiRecommendation.rationale: Static environment non-negotiable for safely managing unknowns and shallow gas risk

lessonsLearned.title: 1980s suspension practices create long-term liability
lessonsLearned.description: Vague records, non-standard plugs, outdated casing grades compound risk over decades

lessonsLearned.title: Inherited wells require comprehensive diagnostic before any intervention
lessonsLearned.description: Never trust legacy records without verification

wells.name: W-33
wells.statusNote: Problem diagnosed, solution approved, awaiting intervention

identity.platform: Brahan Zeta Subsea Manifold (22km tieback to Brahan Alpha)

economics.spentNote: Includes incorrect subsea interventions and diagnostics

reservoir.scaleRisk: Moderate BaSO4, managed by continuous injection

casingProgram.name: Intermediate
casingProgram.notes: THE FLAW: Annulus B inadvertently sealed

tubing.status: COMPROMISED - Being cyclically crushed by TAPB

packer.status: FUNCTIONING - But is the cause of trapped annulus

interventions.objective: Run & set completion, install subsea tree
interventions.outcome: COMPLETED - All activities appeared successful
interventions.aiAnalysis: Packer setting logs show 2-minute deviation where vent port not confirmed open. Probability of trapped annulus: 15%.

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS - 26,500 boepd average
interventions.notes: The golden years

interventions.outcome: INCONCLUSIVE - Attributed to slugging in flowline
interventions.aiAnalysis: Data signature does not match typical slugging. Flagged as unknown transient phenomenon.

interventions.objective: Pig 22km flowline to clear suspected blockage
interventions.outcome: FAILED - Pig ran clean, no blockage found
interventions.notes: First major expense based on flawed theory

interventions.objective: ROV inspection of subsea choke and tree
interventions.outcome: FAILED - Choke and tree fully operational and clean
interventions.notes: The ghost is not in the subsea hardware

interventions.outcome: DECISION - Senior well integrity engineer brought in to challenge existing theories
interventions.notes: The turning point

interventions.outcome: BREAKTHROUGH - Direct correlation found: production heat → Annulus B pressure climb 4,500 psi → casing deformation → tubing choke
interventions.notes: THE PHANTOM FOUND: Thermal-Induced Annular Pressure Build-up (TAPB)

interventions.outcome: PLAN APPROVED - Perforate 9-5/8" casing above packer to equalize pressure
interventions.notes: High-risk, high-reward intervention on producing well

aiRecommendation.summary: LWIV intervention is textbook example of right tool for the job. High-precision, lower-cost solution.
aiRecommendation.recommendation: Use Light Well Intervention Vessel (LWIV) for through-tubing perforation
aiRecommendation.chargeSize: Calculated to penetrate 13Cr-110 casing and cement without damaging 13-3/8" casing
aiRecommendation.monitoring: Real-time acoustic monitoring to confirm perforation and pressure equalization

lessonsLearned.title: Annulus vent port confirmation is mandatory
lessonsLearned.description: 2-minute deviation in packer setting procedure where vent port was not confirmed led to $27M in wasted interventions

lessonsLearned.title: Challenge assumptions before expensive interventions
lessonsLearned.description: Fresh eyes from senior engineer identified the real problem after $13M spent on wrong solutions

economics.spentNote: Includes completion, emergency response, ongoing abandonment

reservoir.geomechanicalContext: CRITICAL - High horizontal stress near critically stressed fault line. Depletion altered stress field, causing fault reactivation.

construction.currentState: CATASTROPHICALLY DAMAGED - Casing sheared at multiple points

completion.status: TOTAL LOSS - Presumed buried and crushed

interventions.objective: Run completion, set packer, install ESP
interventions.outcome: SUCCESS
SUCCESS - 24,000 bopd average, best well in field
interventions.notes: The golden years

interventions.outcome: TOTAL PRODUCTION LOSS - Wellhead pressure dropped to zero in seconds. High-frequency vibrations recorded on platform deck.
interventions.aiAnalysis: Platform seismic sensors recorded Mw 2.1 microseismic event directly beneath well. Flagged as critical geomechanical event.

interventions.objective: Verify well integrity, check for leaks
interventions.outcome: NO SURFACE LEAKS - Wellhead and tree intact. Annulus pressures stable but zero.
interventions.notes: Problem is deep downhole. Well is not leaking, it's broken.

interventions.outcome: FAILED - Drift held up at 2,100m
interventions.notes: Major downhole problem far above reservoir

interventions.outcome: CATASTROPHIC FINDING - Tool stuck at 2,050m. Data showed >70% ovality in 9-5/8" casing.
interventions.notes: Casing is crushed, not just deformed. Well is total loss.

interventions.outcome: DECISION - W-44 declared constructive total loss. Intervention efforts cease. Focus on safe abandonment and root cause.
interventions.notes: The Shifter is dead. Investigation begins.

interventions.outcome: MAJOR FINDING - Depletion reactivated pre-existing fault, causing ~1.5m shear at W-44 wellbore. Similar risks identified at two other wells.
interventions.notes: Failure of W-44 has saved the rest of the field. Production rates at nearby wells proactively reduced.

aiRecommendation.summary: All options to restore production rejected with 100% confidence. Only safe option is relief well for P&A.
aiRecommendation.recommendation: Drill Jack-Up Relief Well to intercept at 4,000m TVD (500m below shallowest confirmed shear)
aiRecommendation.rationale: Industry-standard safest method for dealing with sheared well. Provides absolute control over kill operation.
aiRecommendation.secondaryAction: Continue production management at nearby wells based on geomechanical model

lessonsLearned.title: Reservoir depletion can reactivate pre-existing faults
lessonsLearned.description: Stress field changes from production caused Mw 2.1 event and 1.5m shear

lessonsLearned.title: Single well failure provided data to protect entire field
lessonsLearned.description: W-44 sacrifice enabled proactive rate reductions at at-risk wells

wells.name: W-55
safetyLockReasons: Tubing plugged with frac sand and gel

reservoir.subsurfaceContext: CRITICAL - 450m from W-56. High-perm streak connecting wellbores not accounted for in W-56 frac model.

tubing.status: SEVERELY PLUGGED with frac sand and gel

completion.perforations: 2,910-3,000m, 4 SPF, 60° phasing - NOW OPEN TO HIGH-PRESSURE CHANNEL

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS
SUCCESS - 5,500 bopd average, steady and reliable
interventions.notes: The steady years

interventions.objective: Massive multi-stage hydraulic frac on new well W-56
interventions.outcome: COMPLETED - W-56 brought online at 25,000 bopd
interventions.aiAnalysis: Fracture model did not include high-perm streak. 70% probability of inter-well communication.

interventions.outcome: W-55 PRODUCTION DIES - Well starts producing 100% water with frac sand and polymer gel. THP spikes erratically.
interventions.aiAnalysis: Fluid fingerprint from W-55 is 99.8% match to W-56 frac fluid. Diagnosis: FRACTURE HIT.

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS - Well shut in
interventions.notes: The damage is done. The well is dead.

interventions.outcome: CONCLUSION - W-55 killed by W-56 frac. Reservoir pressure around W-55 drawn down by high-production channel to W-56.
interventions.notes: Major financial and operational failure. Value of W-55 destroyed.

interventions.outcome: DECISION - Constructive total loss. Cost of repair prohibitive. Will be P&A'd to prevent thief zone.
interventions.notes: Must seal off fracture channel to protect W-56 production

aiRecommendation.summary: All options to restore production rejected with 100% confidence. Reservoir energy permanently diverted.
aiRecommendation.recommendation: Use platform workover rig for full P&A
aiRecommendation.criticalRequirement: Abandonment must place permanent cement plug ABOVE top perforations to seal high-conductivity fracture channel
aiRecommendation.rationale: Prevent W-55 from siphoning pressure and fluids from W-56

lessonsLearned.title: Fracture modeling must include high-perm streaks between wells
lessonsLearned.description: 450m spacing with unaccounted high-perm streak led to catastrophic frac hit

lessonsLearned.title: Legacy wells at risk from aggressive stimulation of new wells
lessonsLearned.description: W-55's 16-year production history destroyed in 2 days by W-56 frac

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS
SUCCESS - Flowed above prognosis
SUCCESS (routine)
CATASTROPHIC FAILURE
interventions.rootCause: FOD (tong die), crew on 14th consecutive night shift
interventions.damage: TRSSV profile damaged, debris in wellbore, casing deformed from excessive jarring

interventions.outcome: PARTIAL SUCCESS
interventions.notes: Replaced upper completion, discovered >20% casing ovality at 4,500m. Well returned at 4,500 boepd (from 10,500)

interventions.outcome: FAILED - Stuck closed
interventions.notes: Well shut-in since

aiRecommendation.summary: Despite high risk, expected value is strongly positive. Complex intervention justified.

phases.name: SSV Replacement/Bypass
phases.scope: Lock TRSSV open, install IRSV above

lessonsLearned.title: Tong dies must be tethered, mandatory tool count verification
14+ night shifts correlated with incident, flag crew rotation >10 days
LIB impression dismissed - mandatory offsite expert review for unexplained failures
Fiscal deadline pressure contributed to aggressive jarring
Team didn't recognize POOH through TRSSV with expanded element was high-risk

identity.operator: Brahan Field Operating Company (Inherited from Britannia Oil Co. - defunct since 1998)

reservoir.subsurfaceContext: CRITICAL - Shallow gas and poorly consolidated sands near seabed. Original conductor likely driven, not drilled and cemented.

completion.perforations: 1,910-2,000m, 4 SPF, 60° phasing - ASSUMED COMMUNICATING WITH LEAK SOURCE

interventions.outcome: SUCCESS for the era
SUCCESS - 2,200 bopd average
interventions.notes: The long, steady years

interventions.outcome: PARTIAL SUCCESS - Production increased slightly but continued to decline
interventions.notes: The well is old and tired

interventions.outcome: DECISION - Well no longer economic. Shut in for standard P&A.
DISASTER - Light intermittent oil sheen detected emanating from seabed ~10m from wellhead
interventions.notes: The Politician is born. Well is now major liability.

interventions.objective: Install clamp-on repair patch over suspected leak point
interventions.outcome: FAILED - Leak rate unchanged. Source is deeper than the clamp.
interventions.notes: A $5M patch that didn't work. Regulatory fines increase.

interventions.objective: Squeeze cement into well's annulus to seal leak
interventions.outcome: FAILED - May have created new micro-fractures, worsening situation
interventions.notes: A $10M failure. Company now under intense regulatory scrutiny.

interventions.outcome: Leak persists at 5-10 liters/day. Fines and legal fees exceed $1M/month.
interventions.notes: The well is a financial black hole

aiRecommendation.summary: Cut & Cap operation has positive NPV of >$200M even accounting for 10% failure risk.
aiRecommendation.recommendation: Use Jack-Up Rig for Cut & Cap operation
aiRecommendation.method: Diamond wire saw to cut casing below seabed, place weighted cap over stump
aiRecommendation.backupPlan: Relief Well if Cut & Cap fails

lessonsLearned.title: 1970s construction practices create multi-decade environmental liability
lessonsLearned.description: Driven conductors, outdated casing grades, and vague cement records

lessonsLearned.title: P&A aging wells before they become leaking liabilities
lessonsLearned.description: Delaying P&A increased costs from ~$10M (2018) to potentially $250M+ (10-year projection)
